decision.title: Former Property Administration Director Blažo Šaranović Arrested for Abuse of Office
decision.summary: The Special State Prosecutor's Office (SDT) arrested former Property Administration director Blažo Šaranović along with two associates on February 16, 2026, on suspicion of abuse of official position. The arrests, carried out by special police in Podgorica and Budva, relate to a suspicious €9 million real estate contract signed in 2020 under Šaranović's leadership. Šaranović, a DPS Main Board member, led the Property Administration from 2012 to early 2021. Reported by Portal Analitika, Danas, Kurir, and Adria TV.
decision.full_text:
On the morning of February 16, 2026, the Special State Prosecutor's Office (SDT) ordered the arrest of Blažo Šaranović, former director of the Property Administration of Montenegro, along with two associates: Branko Danilović (a public procurement official at the Property Administration) and Duško Radunović (owner of the firm 'Stan projekt'). Special police units conducted simultaneous operations in Podgorica and Budva.

The arrests were made on suspicion of 'abuse of official position' (zloupotreba službenog položaja).

Šaranović served as director of the Property Administration from 2012 until his removal in early January 2021. He is a member of the Main Board of the Democratic Party of Socialists (DPS) and worked in the state system for more than 15 years. In 2005 he was assistant director of the Office for Common Affairs of State Bodies, and seven years later was appointed director of the Property Administration.

The investigation centers on a controversial contract valued at approximately nine million euros that the Property Administration, under Šaranović's leadership, signed in summer 2020 with the company Koti nekretnine. The property transaction involved 5,600 square meters of real estate in central Podgorica, which was later sold to the state for use by statistical agencies, among other purposes. Prior to the government purchase, the property was owned by a firm called 'Volvox.'

The investigation was conducted by special police units beginning in late 2023, examining the legitimacy of this significant real estate transaction.
decision.title_mne: Bivši direktor Uprave za imovinu Blažo Šaranović uhapšen zbog zloupotrebe službenog položaja
decision.summary_mne: Specijalno državno tužilaštvo (SDT) uhapsilo je bivšeg direktora Uprave za imovinu Blaža Šaranovića zajedno sa dva saradnika 16. februara 2026. godine, zbog sumnje na zloupotrebu službenog položaja. Hapšenja, koja je izvela specijalna policija u Podgorici i Budvi, odnose se na sumnjivu kupoprodaju nekretnina vrijednu 9 miliona eura potpisanu 2020. godine pod Šaranovićevim rukovodstvom. Šaranović, član Glavnog odbora DPS-a, bio je na čelu Uprave za imovinu od 2012. do početka 2021. godine. Izvještavali Portal Analitika, Danas, Kurir i Adria TV.
